meta.title: Drug Interactions
meta.subtitle: Kavalactones inhibit important liver enzymes: What you need to know about CYP450 interactions and safe combinations.

zusammenfassung.title: Important Warning
zusammenfassung.intro: Kava has a high potential for drug interactions due to the inhibition of cytochrome P450 enzymes. Never combine Kava with:

cyp450.title: The Cytochrome P450 System
cyp450.intro: The cytochrome P450 system (CYP450) is a family of enzymes in the liver responsible for the metabolism of most medications. When a substance inhibits these enzymes, other substances are metabolized more slowly – their effects and side effects can therefore be amplified.

importance.title: Why is this important?
importance.text: About 70-80% of all medications are metabolized by CYP450 enzymes. When Kava inhibits these enzymes, the concentration of other medications in the blood can increase – sometimes to dangerous levels. This is especially true for medications with a narrow therapeutic window, where small changes in dosage can have significant effects.

enzyme.intro: Studies by Mathews et al. (2002) and other researchers have shown that Kavalactones inhibit several important CYP450 enzymes:

klinischeBedeutung.title: Clinical Significance
klinischeBedeutung.text: A study by Russmann et al. (2005) showed that traditional aqueous Kava extracts also inhibit CYP1A2 in humans. The inhibition was dose-dependent and clinically relevant. This means that even traditionally prepared Kava can cause interactions.

positive.title: Positive Side Effect?
positive.text: The CYP1A2 inhibition could theoretically provide a protective effect against certain environmental carcinogens that are activated by this enzyme. This could explain why Pacific populations have low cancer rates despite high Kava consumption.

hochrisiko.title: High-Risk Combinations
hochrisiko.intro: The following combinations should be avoided at all costs. They can lead to severe, potentially life-threatening side effects.

alkohol.title: Alcohol
alkohol.intro: The combination of Kava and alcohol is particularly dangerous for several reasons:

points.label: Synergistic Sedation
points.text: Both substances have a sedative effect on the CNS. The combined effect is stronger than the sum of the individual effects.

points.label: Additive Hepatotoxicity
points.text: Both substances are metabolized in the liver and can burden it. The combination significantly increases the risk of liver damage.

points.label: CYP Interaction
points.text: Alcohol also affects CYP enzymes, which can lead to unpredictable interactions.

alkohol.recommendation: Recommendation: At least 24 hours between alcohol and Kava consumption.

benzodiazepine.title: Benzodiazepines & Sleep Medications
benzodiazepine.intro: Benzodiazepines (Diazepam, Lorazepam, Alprazolam, etc.) and Z-Drugs (Zolpidem, Zopiclone) should never be combined with Kava:

points.label: Increased Sedation
points.text: Both act on GABA receptors and enhance each other

points.label: Respiratory Depression
points.text: The combination can dangerously slow down breathing

points.label: CYP3A4 Inhibition
points.text: Kava slows the metabolism of benzodiazepines, prolonging their effect

benzodiazepine.caseReport: Almeida & Grimsley (1996) reported on a 54-year-old man who fell into a semi-comatose state after combining Kava with Alprazolam.

antipsychotika.title: Antipsychotics
antipsychotika.intro: Antipsychotics such as Haloperidol, Risperidone, Olanzapine, and Clozapine:

antikoagulantien.title: Anticoagulants (Blood Thinners)
antikoagulantien.intro: Warfarin and other vitamin K antagonists:

points.label: CYP2C9 Inhibition
points.text: Kava inhibits the enzyme that metabolizes Warfarin

points.label: Risk of Bleeding
points.text: Can lead to dangerous internal bleeding

antikoagulantien.recommendation: Kava is contraindicated when taking anticoagulants.

moderatesRisiko.title: Combinations with Moderate Risk
moderatesRisiko.intro: The following combinations require caution and should only be undertaken after consulting a physician. A dosage adjustment may be necessary.

mao.title: MAO Inhibitors:
items: Theoretical risk, but clinically poorly documented

antikonvulsiva.title: Anticonvulsants (Antiepileptics)
antikonvulsiva.intro: Phenytoin, Carbamazepine, Valproate, and other anticonvulsants:
antikonvulsiva.note: In epilepsy, Kava should only be used under medical supervision.

parkinson.title: Parkinson's Medications

points.label: Dopamine Antagonism
points.text: Kava may reduce the effect of Levodopa

points.label: Case Report
points.text: Worsening of Parkinson's symptoms documented under Kava

parkinson.recommendation: Kava is contraindicated in Parkinson's disease.

hepatotoxisch.title: Hepatotoxic Medications
hepatotoxisch.note: Combining with hepatotoxic medications increases the risk of liver damage.

items.label: Check Medication List
items.text: Review all current medications for interactions

items.label: Consult a Doctor
items.text: Seek medical advice before Kava consumption if taking medications regularly

items.label: Avoid Alcohol
items.text: Do not drink alcohol at least 24 hours before and after Kava consumption

items.label: Dose Low
items.text: Start with a lower Kava dose when taking medications simultaneously

items.label: Monitor Symptoms
items.text: Watch for unusual fatigue, dizziness, or other symptoms

professionalNote.title: Note for Physicians and Pharmacists
professionalNote.text: In patients consuming Kava, a review of medications for CYP450 substrates should be conducted. Special caution is warranted for medications with a narrow therapeutic window. A dosage adjustment may be necessary.
